item.title: 前联邦紧急事务管理局官员称洪水保险计划 "急需 "全面改革
item.description: 联邦紧急事务管理局前副局长丹尼尔-卡尼维斯基（Daniel Kaniewski）认为，国家洪水保险计划早该进行改革了。【原文：The National Flood Insurance Program is overdue for reform, according to Daniel Kaniewski, a former deputy administrator at the Federal Emergency Management Agency.】

item.title: 远离米尔顿中心的弗罗里达人饱受风暴之苦
item.description:
肆虐皮尔斯堡的龙卷风表明，飓风可以在广大地区造成严重破坏 

Tornadoes that tore through Fort Pierce show how hurricanes can cause serious damage over a vast area 

】

item.title: 拜登将于周日访问佛罗里达州调查米尔顿事故造成的损失
item.description: 乔-拜登总统将于周日前往佛罗里达州，亲眼目睹飓风米尔顿造成的破坏。米尔顿飓风是最近几周袭击佛罗里达州的两场强风暴中的第二场，已成为 2024 年大选的一个政治议题。【原文：President Joe Biden will travel to Florida on Sunday to see firsthand the damage from Hurricane Milton, the second of two powerful storms that have battered the state in recent weeks and became a political issue in the 2024 election.】

item.title: 如果没有气候变化，飓风米尔顿可能会成为 2 级风暴
item.description:
一项快速科学分析发现，化石燃料和其他温室气体污染增加了暴风雨引发大风和暴雨的可能性。【原文：

A rapid scientific analysis found that fossil-fuel and other greenhouse gas pollution increased the likelihood of the storm’s high winds and heavy rains.

】

item.title: 尽管拜登誓言应对气候变化，石化厂仍获得美国贷款
item.description: 美国进出口银行批准了一笔 6.9 亿美元的贷款，以帮助在马来西亚建设一家石化厂，尽管气候活动人士表示反对，称该项目违背了拜登-哈里斯政府关于停止资助海外化石燃料项目的承诺。【原文：The US Export-Import Bank authorized a $690 million loan to help help build a petrochemical plant in Malaysia, despite objections from climate activists who say the project flouts Biden-Harris administration promises to halt financing for fossil fuel projects abroad.】

item.title: 气候灾害重塑美国总统竞选格局
item.description: 今天的时事通讯关注气候变化如何在两次毁灭性飓风袭击后成为美国大选的焦点。您可以在 Bloomberg.com 上阅读和分享本篇报道的完整版。如需无限制访问，请订阅。【原文：Today’s newsletter looks at how climate change has moved to the forefront of the US election after two destructive hurricane strikes. You can read and share a full version of this story on Bloomberg.com. For unlimited access, please subscribe.】

item.title: 双拳风暴将气候问题推向美国总统竞选的风口浪尖
item.description:
飓风 "海伦 "和 "米尔顿 "的袭击使应对气候灾害成为大赛最后几周的主要议题。【原文：

The strikes by Hurricanes Helene and Milton have made dealing with climate disasters a major issue in the contest’s final weeks.

】

item.title: 欧洲风力发电量因飓风 "柯克 "余波而飙升
item.description: 飓风 "柯克 "的余威继续对欧洲造成影响，据彭博模型预测，周日的风力将达到二月份以来的最高值。【原文：The remnants of Hurricane Kirk are continuing to have an impact on Europe with the highest wind generation on Sunday since February forecast by Bloomberg models.】

item.title: 交付令人失望后，Polestar 首席执行官开始进行审查
item.description: Polestar Automotive Holding UK Plc 的新任首席执行官 Michael Lohscheller 启动了对运营和战略的审查，此前这家陷入困境的电动汽车制造商报告的交付量低于预期。【原文：Polestar Automotive Holding UK Plc’s new Chief Executive Officer Michael Lohscheller has launched a review of operations and strategy, after the struggling electric-car maker reported weaker-than-expected deliveries.】

item.title: 在亚洲，亚马逊更青睐太阳能和风能，而非核能
item.description: 亚马逊公司（Amazon.com Inc. ）目前只考虑利用风能和太阳能为亚洲的项目提供绿色电力，尽管全球科技公司已开始研究利用核能发电为高能耗的数据中心供电。【原文：Amazon.com Inc. is currently only looking at wind and solar to offer green power for projects in Asia, even as global technology companies begin examining nuclear generation to supply energy-hungry data centers.】

item.title: ACX 将在一年后关闭阿布扎比碳交易所
item.description: AirCarbon 交易所在阿布扎比开展交易仅一年后就将关闭业务。【原文：AirCarbon Exchange is closing its operations in Abu Dhabi after only one year of trading.】

item.title: 日本最大的商业游说团体呼吁扩建核电站
item.description: 日本最大的商业游说团体日本经济团体联合会（Keidanren）呼吁政府将核能扩张纳入正在修订的国家能源战略。【原文：Japan’s biggest business lobby Keidanren called on the government to include nuclear power expansion in the national energy strategy currently under revision.】

item.title: 随着交易系统的扩展，中国要求提供船舶排放数据
item.description: 中国当局已开始要求一些海外船东报告其碳排放量，这凸显出随着监管框架的转变，对该行业的审查也在加强。【原文：Authorities in China have started to ask some overseas shipowners to report on their carbon emissions, highlighting greater scrutiny of the industry as the regulatory framework shifts.】

item.title: Northvolt 创始人的下一个绿色大赌注面临电力问题
item.description:
瑞典已着手耗资1000亿美元改造世界上一些最肮脏的行业。但是，作为首批行动者之一的电池制造商诺斯沃尔特（Northvolt）却遇到了麻烦，这让人怀疑这项雄心勃勃的计划能否成功。【原文：

Sweden has embarked on a $100 billion effort to remake some of the world’s dirtiest industries. But troubles at battery maker Northvolt, one of the first movers, are sowing doubt the ambitious plans can succeed.

】

item.title: 宜家业主为推动绿色发展增持澳大利亚风电场股份
item.description: 拥有全球大部分宜家商店的英卡集团的投资部门收购了澳大利亚维多利亚州一个大型风力发电厂的新股份。【原文：The investment arm of Ingka Group, which owns most of the world’s Ikea stores, has acquired new stakes in a large Australian wind farm in Victoria state.】

item.title: 米尔顿的惊喜是强风造成的破坏
item.description: 周四，佛罗里达州各地的天空开始放晴，人们首次看到了飓风米尔顿造成的破坏性损失；数百万人断电，农作物受损，房屋被毁，至少 10 人死亡。【原文：As skies began to clear across Florida Thursday, they offered a first glimpse of Hurricane Milton’s devastating toll — millions without power, crops damaged, homes destroyed and at least 10 people dead.】

item.title: 特斯拉 "机器人出租车日 "来临，马斯克声誉堪忧
item.description: 特斯拉公司（Tesla Inc. ）今天晚些时候将最终揭晓其期待已久的无人驾驶机器人出租车原型，这将长期影响该公司及其首席执行官埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的命运。【原文：Tesla Inc. will finally reveal its long-awaited driverless robotaxi prototype later today, in a moment that will long affect the fortunes of the company and its Chief Executive Officer Elon Musk.】

item.title: 报告引发新一轮争论，特鲁多碳税陷入困境
item.description: 总理贾斯汀-特鲁多（Justin Trudeau）提出的全国碳价格面临着新一轮激烈的政治争论，因为支出监督机构坚持他的结论，即大多数家庭的经济状况将因碳税而恶化。【原文：Prime Minister Justin Trudeau’s national carbon price faced a fresh round of fierce political bickering after a spending watchdog stood by his conclusion that most households will be worse off due to the tax.】

item.title: 米尔顿飓风过后，未经处理的污水涌入佛罗里达州的洪水中
item.description: 受飓风米尔顿影响，饱受停电和房屋被毁之苦的佛罗里达人又要面对一个新问题：污水涌入洪水。【原文：Storm-racked Floridians dealing with power outages and destroyed homes left in Hurricane Milton’s wake have a new problem to contend with: Sewage swirling into floodwaters.】

item.title: 泰克首席执行官称加拿大必须加大投入以削弱中国在关键矿产领域的主导地位
item.description: 泰克资源有限公司（Teck Resources Ltd. ）首席执行官警告加拿大政府，政府在促进关键矿产部门发展方面做得还不够。【原文：Teck Resources Ltd.’s chief executive officer warned the Canadian government that it isn’t doing enough to foster development in the critical minerals sector.】

item.title: 英国成立顾问小组帮助实现 2030 年清洁电力目标
item.description: 英国召集了一个由来自工业界和学术界的八位专家组成的小组，以帮助实现该国在本十年末实现电网去碳化的目标。【原文：The UK convened a group of eight experts from industry and academia to help reach the country’s goal of decarbonizing the power grid by the end of the decade.】

item.title: 密尔顿导致数百万人停电，航班受阻
item.description: 飓风米尔顿周三晚些时候在佛罗里达州萨拉索塔附近咆哮登陆，造成至少 10 人死亡，300 多万用户断电，并引发大范围洪灾。但官员们谨慎乐观地认为，损失不会达到 2022 年飓风伊恩造成的程度。【原文：Hurricane Milton roared ashore in Florida near Sarasota late Wednesday killing at least 10, knocking out power to more than 3 million customers and causing widespread flooding. But officials were cautiously optimistic that damage won’t reach the level wrought by Hurricane Ian in 2022.】

item.title: 佛罗里达州遭受米尔顿飓风严重破坏，但躲过了最坏的结果
item.description: 飓风 "米尔顿 "昨晚在佛罗里达州西海岸肆虐，横穿佛罗里达州后，转入大西洋。评估损失需要数天时间，但由于飓风的路径略有改变，佛罗里达州似乎避免了最坏的结果。阅读 Bloomberg.com 上有关 Milton 的更多报道。如需无限制访问，请订阅。【原文：Hurricane Milton roared onto Florida’s west coast last night and across the state before spinning into the Atlantic. It will take days to assess the damage, but the state seems to have avoided the worst possible outcome, thanks to a slight shift in the storm’s track. Read more coverage of Milton on Bloomberg.com. For unlimited access, please subscribe.】

item.title: 米尔顿的佛罗里达停电事故因海伦娜破坏而更加严重
item.description: 在飓风米尔顿的破坏下，佛罗里达州 300 多万户家庭和企业于周四上午停电。当地电力公司表示，由于两周前飓风 "海伦 "刚刚袭击了佛罗里达州西海岸，这次飓风造成的破坏使停电更加严重。【原文：The power was out for more than 3 million homes and businesses in Florida on Thursday morning after the destruction from Hurricane Milton. Local utilities say that the blackouts were made worse by the fact the storm came on the heels of damage from Hurricane Helene, which struck the state’s west coast just two weeks ago.】

item.title: 米尔顿袭击后，巨灾债券躲过最坏情况
item.description: 在担心飓风米尔顿带来的最坏影响之后，巨灾债券投资者遭受的损失似乎远远低于本周三的预测。【原文：After fearing the worst from Hurricane Milton, investors in catastrophe bonds appear to have sustained losses well below those predicted as recently as Wednesday.】

item.title: 埃克森公司获准在得克萨斯州建造美国最大的近海碳封存场地
item.description: 埃克森美孚公司赢得了在墨西哥湾得克萨斯州水域下抽取二氧化碳的权利，这将是美国同类产品中最大的特许权。【原文：Exxon Mobil Corp. won the right to pump carbon dioxide beneath Texas state waters in the Gulf of Mexico, in what will be the largest concession of its kind in the US.】

item.title: 密尔顿致命龙卷风揭示隐藏的飓风威胁
item.description: 当飓风米尔顿逼近佛罗里达海岸时，当局发出了灾难性洪水和危险狂风的警告。但是，飓风带来的最具破坏性的影响是许多人始料未及的：一连串异常强大的龙卷风。【原文：As Hurricane Milton approached Florida’s coast, authorities warned of catastrophic flooding and dangerous winds. But among its most devastating impacts is one many people didn’t expect: a rash of unusually powerful tornadoes.】

item.title: 快速加强 "如何让强飓风变得更强
item.description: 许多飓风在公海上肆虐时，力量会慢慢增强。但最近的一系列飓风却以惊人的速度从热带风暴发展而来。【原文：Many hurricanes slowly build strength as they churn across open ocean. But a string of recent hurricanes have grown from a tropical storm with stunning speed.】

item.title: 科克风暴引发暴雨，巴黎东部发出洪水警报
item.description: 飓风 "柯克 "的残余给法国北部带来暴雨，巴黎以东的塞纳-马恩省已进入洪水红色预警状态。【原文：France’s Seine-et-Marne, just east of Paris, is on red alert for flooding after the remnants of Hurricane Kirk brought heavy rain across the north of the country.】

item.title: EDF 寻求筹集多达 40 亿英镑的资金帮助英国欣克利核电站的建设
item.description: 法国电力公司（Electricite de France SA）正在与投资者就英国欣克利角 C 核电站的资金问题进行谈判，因为法国电力公司正在努力解决项目成本膨胀的问题。【原文：Electricite de France SA is holding talks with investors over funding for the Hinkley Point C nuclear power plant under construction in the UK, as the French utility grapples with the ballooning cost of the project.】
